command: 8-bit direct mode single byte digitized sound output
comments: Output one byte unsigned digitized sound data to the DSP. The application is responsible for controlling the sampling rate.

command: 8-bit single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound output
comments: Output unsigned digitized sound data using Single-cycle DMA mode. wLength is a word giving the number of 8-bit samples less 1.

command: Creative 8-bit to 2-bit ADPCM single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound output
comments: Output subsequent blocks of digitized sound data compressed with Creative 8-bit to 2-bit ADPCM using single-cycle DMA mode. wLength is a word giving the number of bytes to transfer less 1. The first block of digitized sound ADPCM data must be transferred with the {italic:reference byte} command.

command: Creative 8-bit to 2-bit ADPCM single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound output with reference byte
comments: Output first block of digitized sound data compressed with Creative 8-bit to 2-bit ADPCM using single-cycle DMA mode. wLength is a word giving the number of bytes to transfer less 1. Subsequent blocks are transferred with the no {italic:reference byte} command.

command: 8-bit auto-init DMA mode digitized sound output
comments: Output unsigned digitized sound data using auto-init DMA mode. The DSP will generate an interrupt to signal the application after transferring every Block of data of size set by command 48h.

command: Creative 8-bit to 2-bit ADPCM auto-init DMA mode digitized sound output with reference byte
comments: Output digitized sound data compressed with Creative 8-bit to 2-bit ADPCM using auto-init DMA mode. Refer to command 1Ch on how to terminate an auto-init transfer. If the transfer is terminated by programming the last block to single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound I/O, the last block must be programmed with the no reference byte command, 16h.

command: 8-bit direct mode single byte digitized sound input
comments: Input one byte of unsigned digitized sound data from the DSP. The application is responsible for controlling the sampling rate.

command: 8-bit single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound input
comments: Input unsigned digitized sound data using single-cycle DMA mode. wLength is a word giving the number of 8-bit samples less 1.

command: 8-bit auto-init DMA mode digitized sound input
comments: Input unsigned digitized sound data using auto-init DMA mode.

command: Polling mode MIDI input
comments: Input MIDI data from the MIDI port using polling mode.

command: Interrupt mode MIDI input
comments: Input MIDI data from the MIDI port using interrupt mode. After sending this command, DSP will generate an interrupt to signal the application when there is any in-bound MIDI data. To terminate this mode, send the command 31h again.

command: UART polling mode MIDI I/O
comments: For MIDI UART mode, a read from the DSP is taken as reading MIDI data and a write to the DSP is taken as sending MIDI data. To terminate MIDI UART mode, send a DSP reset command. The DSP reset command behaves differently while the DSP is in MIDI UART mode. It terminates MIDI UART mode and restores all DSP parameters to the states prior to entering MIDI UART mode.

command: UART interrupt mode MIDI I/O
comments: After sending this command, the DSP will generate an interrupt to signal the application when there is any in-bound MIDI data. Refer to command 34h on the characteristic of MIDI UART mode and on how to terminate it.

command: UART polling mode MIDI I/O with time stamping
UART interrupt mode MIDI I/O with time stamping
comments: After sending this command, the DSP will generate an interrupt to signal the application when there is any in-bound MIDI data. In-bound MIDI data is time stamped by the DSP. Refer to command 34h on the characteristics of MIDI UART mode and on how to terminate it. Refer to command 36h on MIDI time stamping mode.

command: MIDI output
comments: Output MIDI data to the MIDI port in non-UART mode

command: Set digitized sound transfer Time Constant
comments:
Set the digitized sound I/O transfer Time Constant. Time Constant is the sampling rate representation used by the DSP. It is calculated as:

Time Constant = 65536 - (256 000 000/(channels * sampling rate))

The channels parameter is 1 for mono, 2 for stereo. Only the high byte of the result is sent to the DSP.

command: Set digitized sound output sampling rate
comments: Valid sampling rates range from 5000 to 45 000 Hz inclusive. Unlike the Time Constant, there is no need to pre-multiply the sampling rate by two before programming the sampling rate for stereo digitized sound I/O.

command: Set digitized sound input sampling rate
comments: Refer to command 41h.

command: Set DSP block transfer size
comments: The DSP will generate an interrupt after transferring the block of data. wBlockSize is a word giving the number of bytes to transfer less 1. This command is used with high-speed mode and auto-init DMA mode.

command: Creative 8-bit to 4-bit ADPCM single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound output
comments: Refer to command 16h.

command: Creative 8-bit to 4-bit ADPCM single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound output with reference byte
comments: Refer to command 17h.

command: Creative 8-bit to 3-bit ADPCM single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound output
comments: Refer to command 16h.

command: Creative 8-bit to 3-bit ADPCM single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound output with reference byte
comments: Refer to command 17h.

command: Creative 8-bit to 4-bit ADPCM auto-init DMA mode digitized sound output with reference byte
comments: Refer to command 1Fh.

command: Creative 8-bit to 3-bit ADPCM auto-init DMA mode digitized sound output with reference byte
comments: Refer to command 1Fh.

command: Pause DAC for a duration
comments: wDuration is a word giving the duration to pause in the units of sampling period less 1. When the specified duration elapses, the DSP generates an interrupt.

command: 8-bit high-speed auto-init DMA mode digitized sound output
comments: The DSP will generate an interrupt to signal the application after transferring every Block Size of data set by command 48h. In high-speed mode, the DSP will not accept any other commands. To terminate high-speed mode, send a DSP reset command. The DSP reset command behaves differently while the DSP is in high-speed mode. It terminates high-speed mode and restores all DSP parameters to the states prior to entering the high-speed mode.

command: 8-bit high-speed single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound input
comments: After transferring a block of data of size set by command 48h, the DSP will generate an interrupt to signal the application and exit the high-speed mode.

command: 8-bit high-speed auto-init DMA mode digitized sound input
comments: Refer to command 90h.

command: 8-bit high-speed single-cycle DMA mode digitized sound input
comments: Refer to command 91h.

command: Set input mode to mono
comments: The default input mode is mono.

command: Set input mode to stereo
comments: This command must be sent if stereo recording is desired. After recording, command A0h must be sent to set the input mode back to mono. This command no longer exists on DSP version 4.xx. Refer to commands Bxh and Cxh on stereo recording settings.
